context_bundle.summary: Terraform: Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tool for provisioning cloud resources. Declarative HCL syntax, state management (tracks real resources), providers for AWS/Azure/GCP/etc. Workflow: terraform init (download providers), terraform plan (preview changes), terraform apply (execute), terraform destroy (tear down). Resources: aws_instance, azurerm_virtual_machine, google_compute_instance. Variables for reusability, outputs for values, modules for composition. State: terraform.tfstate (local) or remote backend (S3, Terraform Cloud). Best practices: Use remote state, version providers, modularize, use workspaces for environments (dev/staging/prod), plan before apply, .tfvars for secrets (gitignored).

onboarding.quick_start: Terraform basics: Install: brew install terraform (Mac) or download from terraform.io. HCL config (main.tf): terraform { required_providers { aws = { source = "hashicorp/aws", version = "~> 5.0" } } }; provider "aws" { region = "us-east-1" }; resource "aws_instance" "web" { ami = "ami-12345678"; instance_type = "t2.micro"; tags = { Name = "WebServer" } }. Init: terraform init; # Downloads AWS provider. Plan: terraform plan; # Shows changes (+ create, ~ modify, - destroy). Apply: terraform apply; # Creates resources, updates state. Variables (variables.tf): variable "instance_type" { default = "t2.micro" }; resource uses: instance_type = var.instance_type. Outputs (outputs.tf): output "instance_ip" { value = aws_instance.web.public_ip }. Remote state (backend.tf): terraform { backend "s3" { bucket = "my-terraform-state"; key = "prod/terraform.tfstate"; region = "us-east-1" } }. Modules: module "vpc" { source = "./modules/vpc"; cidr_block = "10.0.0.0/16" }. Destroy: terraform destroy; # Removes all managed resources.
common_patterns: AWS EC2 instance: resource "aws_instance" "app" { ami = var.ami_id; instance_type = "t3.medium"; vpc_security_group_ids = [aws_security_group.app.id]; user_data = file("init.sh"); tags = { Environment = "production" } }

Azure VM: resource "azurerm_virtual_machine" "main" { name = "vm-${var.environment}"; location = azurerm_resource_group.main.location; resource_group_name = azurerm_resource_group.main.name; vm_size = "Standard_DS1_v2" }
Variables with tfvars: terraform.tfvars: instance_type = "t2.large"; environment = "prod"; # terraform apply -var-file=terraform.tfvars
Count for multiple resources: resource "aws_instance" "web" { count = 3; ami = var.ami; instance_type = "t2.micro"; tags = { Name = "web-${count.index}" } }
Conditional resource: resource "aws_s3_bucket" "logs" { count = var.enable_logging ? 1 : 0; bucket = "app-logs-${var.environment}" }

Data sources: data "aws_ami" "ubuntu" { most_recent = true; owners = ["099720109477"]; filter { name = "name"; values = ["ubuntu/images/hvm-ssd/ubuntu-*"] } }; resource uses: ami = data.aws_ami.ubuntu.id

Remote state reference: data "terraform_remote_state" "vpc" { backend = "s3"; config = { bucket = "shared-state"; key = "vpc.tfstate" } }; subnet_id = data.terraform_remote_state.vpc.outputs.subnet_id
Workspaces: terraform workspace new prod; terraform workspace select prod; # Separate state per workspace
Module composition: module "vpc" { source = "terraform-aws-modules/vpc/aws"; version = "3.0.0"; cidr = "10.0.0.0/16"; azs = ["us-east-1a", "us-east-1b"] }
Lifecycle: resource "aws_instance" "app" { lifecycle { create_before_destroy = true; prevent_destroy = false; ignore_changes = [tags] } }
